p: During the recent epidemics in Brazil, the most common signs and symptoms observed in humans were fever, headache, vomiting, jaundice, chills, nausea, abdominal pain, myalgia, arthralgia, rash, diarrhea, bleeding or hemorrhagic signs [ 24â€“ 27]. Recently, in severe YF cases, a critical metabolic acidosis leading to the need for hemodialysis [ 25], increased levels of serum lipase [ 25, 28] and a high prevalence of pancreatitis were observed [ 25]. These studies highlighted the importance of pancreatitis in the evolution of YF and the need for further studies addressing this issue [ 25, 28].
